description: From French tulipe, from earlier tulipan, from Ottoman Turkish دلبند‎ (tülbent, dülbent, “cheesecloth”), from Classical Persian دلبند‎ (dulband, “turban”). Doublet of turban.

entries.meaning: A type of flowering plant, genus Tulipa.
examples: "The sturdy burghers of Holland took the tulip mania so badly that single bulbs that could not flower till another year would sell for more than $2000 apiece."
